story.text: DETROIT Jan 3 Ford Motor Co.(F.N) said on Wednesday it is offering consumer incentives to lease certain top-selling vehicles and interest-free loans on a few others to boost sales momentum for the year. The deals, which run from Jan. 3 through Feb. 28, include zero percent financing for five years on the Ford Escape and Mercury Milan SUV. Ford is offering lease deals on the Fusion sedan for $249 a month for 39 months with no down payment and no money due at signing, the company said. The Milan sedan can be leased for $208 monthly with $1,999 due at signing, and the F-150 pickup truck can be leased starting at $249 a month for 36 months with $1,999 due at signing, Ford said in a statement. Ford's new incentives follow a year-end sales event that expired on Tuesday. The company had offered cash rebates or low-interest financing. Most of the new deals apply to 2007 model-year vehicles. The automaker will report December and year-end sales later on Wednesday.
story.title: ford offers lease incentives , interest - free loans
